Issues.Title: Drag&drop support in grid layout
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/related to the feature request?

_No response_

### Description

We are developing using Angular CDK Drag&Drop function. I'm trying to adjust the order of card components through drag drop in a grid layout with flex applied, but it doesn't work properly in the latest version.

It is possible in the old version, so the example below works, but it doesn't seem to work properly in the latest version. Right now it seems that drag&drop is only possible horizontally or vertically.

https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-dragdrop-grid-pnyded

### Proposed solution

I want to be able to drag drop in card view

### Alternatives considered

There may be a way to use a separate external library, but I think it would be best to officially support it in angular.

https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-ivy-wsegkg

Another solution seems to be this way.
https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-qaxshp
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Drag&drop support in grid layout" (#49346)

Issues.Title: refactor(core): skip hydration annotation
Issues.Body:
This adds the ngSkipHydration annotation, which allows users to opt hydration boundaries out of hydration. This enables incremental adoption of hydration by letting users skip hydration on components that have implementation issues that conflict with hydration.

co-authored-by: @AndrewKushnir

Issues.Title: Language service does not analyze types properly in templates
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

language-service

### Is this a regression?

No idea, probably no

### Description

First of all, Thank you, everyone! This is the best overall framework out there, period! And it is being improved marginally on every release as if it was a new thing, amazing!

Now, about the issue:

There are two types of issues here:
- When you merge an interface and a class, and not implement anything in a class, templates lose intellisense.
- If you have an Enum and use a template literal to take its values only and use them as a union, templates are losing intellisense, kinda, you need to check out the example below to get this fully.

Both are working as intended in the TS files

I tested on VSCode and IntelliJ platform IDES and I believe this is coming from here.

I have provided the stackblitz snippet, you can download it and play with it locally.

### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

https://stackblitz.com/edit/ng15-language-service-problem?file=src/main.ts

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

```true
No errors, just does not work
```


### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`)

```true
Node: 16.18.1
Package Manager: npm 8.19.2
OS: darwin arm64
```

Issues.Title: feat(migrations): Add migration for functional Route guards and resolvers
Issues.Body: This migration updates `Route` definitions to use functions instead of class and `InjectionToken` references in the guard and resolver properties. This is accomplished by using the recently added mapper functions.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(migrations): Add migration for functional Route guards and resolvers" (#49338)

Issues.Title: feat(migrations): Migration to remove `Router` guard and resolver interfaces
Issues.Body:
The class-based guard and resolver interfaces are deprecated. The `Router` types only support functional guards definitions. Classes can still be used as the underlying implementation of functional guards and resolvers but there will not be an interface requiring a specific structure for those classes.

There are also helper functions like `mapToCanActivate` that allow converting the existing class-based guards directly to functional guards at the route definition. This will be done in a separate migration.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(migrations): Migration to remove `Router` guard and resolver interfaces" (#49337)

Issues.Title: Cannot remove outlets from path
Issues.Body: ### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug? router ### Is this a regression? Yes ### Description I have route like this ``` const routes: Routes = [ { path: 'outlet-one', loadChildren: () => import('./outlet-one/outlet-one.module').then(m => m.OutletOneModule), outlet: 'info' }, { path: 'outlet-two', loadChildren: () => import('./outlet-two/outlet-two.module').then(m => m.OutletTwoModule), outlet: 'info' }, { path: 'foo', loadChildren: () => import('./foo/foo.module').then(m => m.FooModule), }, ]; ``` When the route http://localhost:4200/(info:outlet-two') is open. I want to go to http://localhost:4200/foo by clicking an anchor ``` Goto Foo component ``` The link will be http://localhost:4200/foo(info:outlet-two) Expected behavior Link I want http://localhost:4200/foo ### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug https://github.com/docaohuynh/angular15-router-test ### Please provide the exception or error you saw _No response_ ### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`) ```true Angular CLI: 15.2.1 Node: 18.14.1 Package Manager: npm 9.3.1 OS: darwin x64 Angular: 15.2.1 ... animations, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms ... platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, router ``` ### Anything else? _No response_

Issues.Title: Validate `formControlName` for Typed Forms
Issues.Body:
### Command

build, lint, serve

### Description

Now that strongly typed forms exists it would be ideal if the template would also be checked.

Currently `formControlName` accepts `string | number | null`. So incorrect values won't result in build or lint errors.

```html
<form [formGroup]="myTypedForm">
  <input formControlName="myControl">
</form>
```

### Describe the solution you'd like

Validate the input to `formControlName` exists on the relevant typed form when `strictTemplates` is turned on.

### Describe alternatives you've considered

_No response_
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Validate `formControlName` for Typed Forms" (#49334)

Issues.Title: refactor(compiler): required inputs prerequisite refactors
Issues.Body: Based on the discussion in https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/49304#discussion_r1124732608. Reworks how inputs are stored throughout the compiler to allow for required information to be stored alongside them. The refactor introduces a new `ClassInputPropertyMapping` class which is similar to the existing `ClassPropertyMapping`, but with the ability to store additional information about the mapping which may be handy for future features as well.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor(compiler): required inputs prerequisite refactors" (#49333)

Issues.Title: feat(zone.js): support lazy loading zone-testing so the loading order will not be an issue.
Issues.Body:
Close https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/48386

Angular requires to load zone-testing before loading @angular/core/testing,
since zone-testing provide fakeAsync/async test util methods.
So if the user load the bundles with wrong order, please load zone-testing
error will be thrown.
This PR make fakeAsync loading Zone object lazyly, so even the
zone-testing is loaded after @angular/core/testing, the test will
still be success.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(zone.js): support lazy loading zone-testing so the loading order will not be an issue." (#49326)

Issues.Title: feat(common): support ICU standard "quarters (format + standalone)" with `DatePipe`
Issues.Body:
This commit adds support for quarters `q/qq/qqq/qqqq/qqqqq` and `Q/QQ/QQQ/QQQQ/QQQQQ` date formats in the `DatePipe`, as well as extends all locales with format and standalone quarter names.

Fixes #49175

Apart from that this PR updates the following auto-generated files based on what `generate-locales-tool` on top of `CLDR` produces:
* `packages/core/src/i18n/locale_en.ts`
* `packages/common/locales/closure-locale.ts`
* `packages/examples/common/pipes/ts/locale-fr.ts`

- [x] Yes (needs confirmation from Angular team)
- [ ] No

<!-- If this PR contains a breaking change, please describe the impact and migration path for existing applications below. -->
Since this PR extends all locales with format and standalone quarter names, the order of data fields from the locale data array has changed. See an example in `packages/examples/common/pipes/ts/locale-fr.ts`.

Taking it into account, the developers are required to make sure they properly use:
1. Locale data in all locale files under `@angular/common/locales/*` 
2. Enum `ÉµLocaleDataIndex` located at `@angular/core` that represents the index of each type of locale data in locale data array
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(common): support ICU standard "quarters (format + standalone)" with `DatePipe`" (#49324)

Issues.Title: implement lazy loading of markup for improving optimization
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/related to the feature request?

upgrade

### Description

This feature would increase perfomance of Angular application. 
We already had functionality which help us to lazy load components, images, but I suggest to implement functionality which will lazy load divs and any markup also. 

### Proposed solution

It could be a directive.
This will decrease amount of request when page loading, speed of rendering page.
This functionality can be implemented through the Intersection observer itself. But it would be nice to have it out of the box and in the framework functionality itself

### Alternatives considered

An alternative would be to render html with | async only when the user screen is in scope.
This functionality would be very useful
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "implement lazy loading of markup for improving optimization" (#49323)

Issues.Title: fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): build optimizer support for non spec-compliant ES2022 class static properties
Issues.Body:
The build optimizer's static field pass will now additionally wrap classes that contain side effect free TypeScript ES2022 static class properties.

This is needed to update APF to ship ES2022, which have `useDefineForClassFields` set to `false`.

Issues.Title: Library build not minified
Issues.Body:
### Command

build

### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

Not tried this in previous versions

### Description

When performing ng build or ng build --configuration=production, Angular creates a main.*.js, a polyfills.*.js, and a runtime.*.js file all of which are flattened and minified.

When performing ng build or ng build --configuration=production on a standalone Angular component, currently the fesm2015 and fesm2020 folders in the destination folder hold *.mjs and *.mjs.map files, where neither file holds "flattened" code. The standalone component code is easily readable. ng build should flatten the output code, and --configuration=production should minify the flattened code. 

According to:
https://angular.io/guide/angular-package-format

"To generate a flattened ES Module index file, use the following configuration options in your tsconfig.json file":

```
"angularCompilerOptions": {
...
"flatModuleOutFile": "my-ui-lib.js",
"flatModuleId": "my-ui-lib"
}
```

This does not flatten the output from ng build.

**2 REQUESTS:** 
1. Can ng build flatten the output of standalone component libraries?
2. Can ng build --configuration=production minify the flattened output, as in the case of any other Angular application?


### Minimal Reproduction

Run 
ng build my-library-name 

Or 
ng build my-library-name --configuration=production

### Exception or Error

```text
No error to show
```


### Your Environment

```text
Angular CLI: 15.0.0
Node: 16.15.1
Package Manager: npm 8.11.0
OS: win32 x64

Angular: 15.0.0
... animations, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, router

Package                         Version
---------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect       0.1500.0
@angular-devkit/build-angular   15.0.0
@angular-devkit/core            15.0.0
@angular-devkit/schematics      15.0.0
@schematics/angular             15.0.0
ng-packagr                      15.0.0
rxjs                            7.5.7
typescript                      4.8.4
```

> Read more about bzlmod: <https://blog.aspect.dev/bzlmod>

#### Using WORKSPACE

Paste this snippet into your  file:

```starlark
load("@​bazel_tools//tools/build_defs/repo:http.bzl", "http_archive")

http_archive(
    name = "aspect_bazel_lib",
    sha256 = "2518c757715d4f5fc7cc7e0a68742dd1155eaafc78fb9196b8a18e13a738cea2",

    url = "https://github.com/aspect-build/bazel-lib/releases/download/v1.28.0/bazel-lib-v1.28.0.tar.gz",
)

aspect_bazel_lib_dependencies()

```

Optional toolchains:


<details>
<summary>evanw/esbuild</summary>

### [`v0.17.11`](https://togithub.com/evanw/esbuild/blob/HEAD/CHANGELOG.md#​01711)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/evanw/esbuild/compare/v0.17.10...v0.17.11)

-   Fix the `alias` feature to always prefer the longest match ([#​2963](https://togithub.com/evanw/esbuild/issues/2963))

    It's possible to configure conflicting aliases such as `--alias:a=b` and `--alias:a/c=d`, which is ambiguous for the import path `a/c/x` (since it could map to either `b/c/x` or `d/x`). Previously esbuild would pick the first matching `alias`, which would non-deterministically pick between one of the possible matches. This release fixes esbuild to always deterministically pick the longest possible match.

-   Minify calls to some global primitive constructors ([#​2962](https://togithub.com/evanw/esbuild/issues/2962))

    With this release, esbuild's minifier now replaces calls to `Boolean`/`Number`/`String`/`BigInt` with equivalent shorter code when relevant:

    ```js
    // Original code
    console.log(
      Boolean(a ? (b | c) !== 0 : (c & d) !== 0),
      Number(e ? '1' : '2'),
      String(e ? '1' : '2'),
      BigInt(e ? 1n : 2n),
    )

    // Old output (with --minify)
    console.log(Boolean(a?(b|c)!==0:(c&d)!==0),Number(e?"1":"2"),String(e?"1":"2"),BigInt(e?1n:2n));

    // New output (with --minify)
    console.log(!!(a?b|c:c&d),+(e?"1":"2"),e?"1":"2",e?1n:2n);
    ```

-   Adjust some feature compatibility tables for node ([#​2940](https://togithub.com/evanw/esbuild/issues/2940))

    This release makes the following adjustments to esbuild's internal feature compatibility tables for node, which tell esbuild which versions of node are known to support all aspects of that feature:

    -   `class-private-brand-checks`: node v16.9+ => node v16.4+ (a decrease)
    -   `hashbang`: node v12.0+ => node v12.5+ (an increase)
    -   `optional-chain`: node v16.9+ => node v16.1+ (a decrease)
    -   `template-literal`: node v4+ => node v10+ (an increase)

    Each of these adjustments was identified by comparing against data from the `node-compat-table` package and was manually verified using old node executables downloaded from https://nodejs.org/download/release/.

</details>

Issues.Title: ng build Performance Has Degraded Significantly In Upgrade from Angular v12 -> v15
Issues.Body:
### Command

build

### Is this a regression?

- [X] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

12.2.17

### Description

I recently tried to upgrade our large enterprise application (~1300 components) from Angular v12 to v15. After the upgrade, I noticed that 'ng build'  times had increased from around ~13 mins on Angular v12 to 21 mins on Angular v15. 

Here's my project configuration:
"build": {
      "builder": "@angular-devkit/build-angular:browser",
      "options": {
        "allowedCommonJsDependencies": [
          "lodash",
          "highcharts",
          "moment-timezone",

Issues.Title: ng build --watch --watch-matcher="Compiled successfully" --watch-script=sayhi.js
Issues.Body:
### Command

build

### Description

Hello, it would be really cool to be able to execute some code once project has been built again.

```
ng build --watch --watch-matcher="Compiled successfully" --watch-script=sayhi.js
```

After each change, the application gets built, and if --watch-matcher="Compiled successfully" is successful, call the .js file.

### Describe the solution you'd like

if I am in the root of my project, and we have a file called sayhi.js.
```js
// /root/of/app/sayhi.js
console.log('hi');
```
and I start
```
ng build --watch --watch-matcher="Compiled successfully" --watch-script=sayhi.js
```
then, when I change something in my app, app gest built, and if successful, I must see
```
hi
```

### Describe alternatives you've considered

_No response_
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "ng build --watch --watch-matcher="Compiled successfully" --watch-script=sayhi.js" (#24807)

Issues.Title: Using environment.ts value in proxy.config.mjs file
Issues.Body:
### Command

serve

### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

We are trying to use **proxy.config.mjs** (located in src folder) as per [Angular Docs](https://angular.io/guide/build#proxy-multiple-entries) to talk to back-end API in Dev mode but we want to set target value in this proxy conf using environment.ts file.

Have followed all default configurations to set-up proxy.config.mjs, environment files but getting an exception when trying to run `ng serve`

<ins> **Repo Link for the same :** </ins>

https://github.com/codesuman/ng-proxy-test


### Minimal Reproduction

<ins> **UI / Angular Code :** </ins>

git clone https://github.com/codesuman/ng-proxy-test


<ins> **API / Node Code :** </ins>

`index.js`

```
const express = require('express')
const app = express()
const port = 3000

app.get('/', (req, res) => {
  res.send('Hello World!')
})

app.get('/api/tasks', (req, res) => {
  res.send(Array.from(Array(10).keys()).map(n => 't'+n))
})

app.listen(port, () => {
  console.log(`Example app listening on port ${port}`)
})
```

### Exception or Error

```text
An unhandled exception occurred: Cannot find module '/proxy-test/src/environments/environment' imported from proxy-test/src/proxy.config.mjs
```


### Your Environment

```text
Angular CLI: 15.1.3
Node: 16.17.0
Package Manager: npm 8.15.0
OS: darwin x64

Angular: 
... 

Package                      Version
------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect    0.1501.3 (cli-only)
@angular-devkit/core         15.1.3 (cli-only)
@angular-devkit/schematics   15.1.3 (cli-only)
@schematics/angular          15.1.3 (cli-only)
```


### Anything else relevant?

_No response_

Issues.Title: Call retries were exceeded exception while ng build
Issues.Body:
### Command

build

### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

My Angular 10 project is getting bigger, and at some point I've started to get an error while trying to build with `ng build --prod`. When I try to build, I am getting an error at the point of Generating ES5 bundles for differential loading... and it says:

```
An unhandled exception occurred: Call retries were exceeded
See "...\angular-errors.log" for further details.
```

**Error Log:**
```
[error] Error: Call retries were exceeded
    at ChildProcessWorker.initialize (...\node_modules\jest-worker\build\workers\ChildProcessWorker.js:193:21)
    at ChildProcessWorker._onExit (...\node_modules\jest-worker\build\workers\ChildProcessWorker.js:274:12)
    at ChildProcess.emit (events.js:400:28)
    at Process.ChildProcess._handle.onexit (internal/child_process.js:285:12)
```

I've noticed that **if I comment out around 1k lines of my code at any of my components** and try to build, it works. But when I re-open it and build again, then it gives the same error. I need to use differential loading, so I can't close it.

Node.js version: `v14.21.2`
Angular version: `~10.2.0`

**tsconfig.json:**
```{
  "compileOnSave": false,
  "compilerOptions": {
    "baseUrl": "./",
    "outDir": "./dist/out-tsc",
    "sourceMap": true,
    "declaration": false,
    "downlevelIteration": true,
    "experimentalDecorators": true,
    "moduleResolution": "node",
    "importHelpers": true,
    "target": "es2015",
    "module": "es2020",
    "lib": [
      "es2019",
      "es2018",
      "dom"
    ]
  }
}
```

**What I've tried so far?**
- Increased the memory for the build process up to 12 GB - **failed**
- Added "sideEffects": false to my package.json - **failed**
- Deleted and reinstalled node_modules - **failed**
- Setting "target": "es5" in tsconfig.json - **success** (But this disables the differential loading)

### Minimal Reproduction

I don't know how to reproduce the issue. My Angular 10 project is getting bigger, and at some point I've started to get an error while trying to build with `ng build --prod`.

### Exception or Error

```text
[error] Error: Call retries were exceeded
    at ChildProcessWorker.initialize (...\node_modules\jest-worker\build\workers\ChildProcessWorker.js:193:21)
    at ChildProcessWorker._onExit (...\node_modules\jest-worker\build\workers\ChildProcessWorker.js:274:12)
    at ChildProcess.emit (events.js:400:28)
    at Process.ChildProcess._handle.onexit (internal/child_process.js:285:12)
```


### Your Environment

```text
Angular CLI: 10.2.0
Node: 14.21.2
OS: win32 x64

Angular: 10.2.3
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... language-service, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic
... router
Ivy Workspace: Yes

Package                         Version
---------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect       0.1002.0
@angular-devkit/build-angular   0.1002.0
@angular-devkit/core            10.2.0
@angular-devkit/schematics      10.2.0
@angular/cdk                    11.0.2
@angular/cli                    10.2.0
@angular/localize               11.0.3
@angular/material               11.0.3
@schematics/angular             10.2.0
@schematics/update              0.1002.0
rxjs                            6.6.3
typescript                      4.0.2
```


### Anything else relevant?

_No response_

build

You may need an appropriate loader to handle this file type, currently no loaders are configured to process this file. See https://webpack.js.org/concepts#loaders
> @import url("czi-vars.css");
|
| .molm-czi-cursor-placeholder {

Issues.Title: Angular 14 "ng build" breaks concurrent "ng serve"
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

common

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

Consider a workspace with an application `app`and a library `lib`.

Run these commands

1. Run `ng build lib --configuration development --watch`, wait until it finishes
1. In another terminal, run `ng serve app --configuration development`, wait until it finishes
1. End the `ng build lib` process (note: this becomes necessary when `ng build` cannot build incrementally and a restart is required to run a successful build)
1. Repeat the command from step 1


Expected result is that `ng serve` continues working and uses the new version of `lib`. 

### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

_No response_

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

```true
Compiled with problems:X

ERROR

projects/app/...../module.ts:33:8 - error TS2307: Cannot find module 'lib' or its corresponding type declarations.

33 } from 'lib';
          ~~~~~
```

and many other errors all relating to the fact that `qer` cannot be found even though the library was successfully compiled to the `dist/qer` folder.
Restarting `ng serve` fixes the issue.


### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`)

```true
Angular CLI: 14.2.10
Node: 14.21.1
Package Manager: npm 6.14.17
OS: win32 x64

Angular: 14.2.12
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... language-service, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic
... router
```

Issues.Title: fix(material/tabs): Make MatTab _scrollheader function smarter to display content fully
Issues.Body:
_scrollheader() computes the distance to move a tab list. Originally it set the scroll amount to a third of the length of the tab list view window, which did not consider the length of the tab label itself. When the screen size is small, the label might be clipped and not completely readable on its own and users see just the left or right of the tab text.

This PR updates _scrollheader() function to make it smarter on distance calculation. It introduced two variables,
- `minLeftSpace`: the distance from the first fully rendered label to the left border of the viewport.
- `minRightSpace`: the distance from the last fully rendered label to the right border of the viewport.

Now the new scroll amount is,
- 'before' direction: `MINIMUM(minRightSpace, 1/3 * viewLength)`
- 'after' direction:  `MINIMUM(minLeftSpace, 1/3 * viewLength)`

This way, the moving distance would be guarded by the remaining space on either side of the label and we can make sure the label would not be clipped.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR " fix(material/tabs): Make MatTab _scrollheader function smarter to display content fully" (#26737)

Issues.Title: docs-bug(MatFormFieldControl): How to compose/extends a formControl-compatible external library, with MatFormFieldControl ?
Issues.Body:
### Documentation Feedback

Usecase: in my form, i need to replace textarea (inside mat-form-field) with a code editor.

I found `ngx-monaco-editor-v2` which integrates perfectly inside my form .... but not inside a mat-form-field :(

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2692027/223204798-9595744d-fee3-4143-b46b-3d37661a5150.png)

```html
      <mat-form-field>
        <mat-label>Code</mat-label>
        <textarea matInput formControlName="code"></textarea>
        <!-- Does NOT works inside mat-form-field -->
        <!-- <ngx-monaco-editor
          matInput (or matNativeControl)
          formControlName="code"
        ></ngx-monaco-editor> -->
      </mat-form-field>

      <!-- Works outside mat-form-field -->
      <ngx-monaco-editor
        formControlName="code"
      ></ngx-monaco-editor>
```

> Error: mat-form-field must contain a MatFormFieldControl.

I checked this library's source and **it already implement ControlValueAccessor**, but is missing the MatFormFieldControl interface.

The current documentation https://material.angular.io/guide/creating-a-custom-form-field-control#ngcontrol applies only to a full custom component, not for WRAPPING an external library.

So maybe someone have an idea to complement this documentation with this usecase ?

... or maybe a feature request for a `matFormFieldControl` directive like matInput ?

### Affected documentation page

https://material.angular.io/guide/creating-a-custom-form-field-control#ngcontrol
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "docs-bug(MatFormFieldControl): How to compose/extends a formControl-compatible external library, with MatFormFieldControl ?" (#26731)

Issues.Title: bug(mat-button): `ng-container` element is effecting the rendered DOM structure when used with `mat-icon` in `mat-button` template's innerHTML
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [X] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

14

### Description

My understanding of the [`ng-container`](https://angular.io/api/core/ng-container) element is that it can be used with structural directive's in a component's template without affecting the underlying DOM structure. In the MDC version (at version 15) of Angular Material, using `ng-container` within a button has an effect on the rendered DOM.

These expectations are based off of the Angular documentation, as well as my experience with previous versions of Angular Material. This issue was noticed while migrating an existing app to MDC.

### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. Load this stackblitz in a Chromium based browser: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-1fvgpn?file=src%2Fapp%2Fbutton-overview-example.html,src%2Fapp%2Fbutton-overview-example.ts
2. Observe the difference between the disabled button and the enabled button. 


### Expected Behavior

I expect the disabled button (no `ng-container`) and the enabled button (with `ng-container`) to have the same visual appearance and the same DOM structure, since `ng-container` was used to host the `NgIf` directive.

### Actual Behavior

Using `NgIf` on an `ng-container` that contains a `MatIcon` within a `MatButton` is effecting the rendered DOM structure. The disabled button's innerHTML has the `mat-icon` rendered as a direct child of the `button`. The enabled button renders the `mat-icon` within the `span.mdc-button__label` element, as a "grandchild" of the `button`.

This difference in DOM structure leads to an inconsistent visual appearance that is challenging for library consumers to style away. I believe this breaks the expectations of the `NgContainer` API.

### Environment

- Angular: ~15.2
- CDK/Material: ~15.2
- Browser(s): Chromium
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): N/A
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(mat-button): `ng-container` element is effecting the rendered DOM structure when used with `mat-icon` in `mat-button` template's innerHTML" (#26714)

Issues.Title: fix(material/checkbox): fix ARIA semantics and use native DOM properties
Issues.Body:
For the checkbox component, fix semantics so that a11y produces a state of "mixed" when both the `checked` and `indeterminate` Inputs to mat-checkbox are both true.

Also, remove the use of aria-checked in favor of the native DOM properties for checked and indeterminate. Conform to [ARIA in HTML W3C input checkbox specification](https://www.w3.org/TR/html-aria/#el-input-checkbox).

Fix a11y bug where checkbox renders the indeterminate visual state but accessibility tree has a state of "checked". Aligns with native checkbox, which produces the mixed state when indeterminate property is true, regardless of the value of the checked property.

Some accessibility checkers produce an error when native checkbox has aria-checked on it. Remove aria-checked to fix errors.

Does not make visual changes.

Fix #26709
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(material/checkbox): fix ARIA semantics and use native DOM properties" (#26710)
